alert.note: Alert for Boone; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Putnam; Roane; Southeast Fayette (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 31 at 10:43AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Nicholas, Kanawha, central Putnam, southern Roane, southwestern Clay, southeastern Jackson, central Fayette and northeastern Boone Counties through 1115 AM EDT... At 1042 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South Charleston, or near Charleston, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Nitro, Fayetteville, Winfield, Clay, Jefferson, South Charleston, St. Albans, Dunbar, Oak Hill, Sissonville, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Eleanor, Marmet, Ansted, Belle, Clendenin, Cedar Grove and Poca. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 123. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 38 and 57. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 62 and 95. Route 119 between mile markers 69 and 80. Route 19 between mile markers 14 and 30. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
